CreditLine: Bequest of Mrs. Jean M. Riddell, 2010
Description: In this scene, Two Swans, Study (1905), a couple wearing medieval dress and holding hands stroll beside a pond in a wooded landscape. The two swans, which gave the original painting its title, are not represented.* Framing the miniature are what appear to be stage curtains in olive hung against a dark blue ground. The remainder of the box has finely executed filigree decoration with shaded enamel in dark blue, light blue, and brown. A similar box is in the collection in the Hillwood Museum and Gardens, Washington, D.C.

Inscriptions: [Symbols] On base: kokoshnik right, delta, 88; [Marks] In Cyrillic: Fabergé with Imperial warrant; [Marks] Inside lid in Cyrillic: K. Fabergé with Imperial warrant, 88
Medium: silver gilding, painted filigree and en plein enamel
Provenance: Jean M. Riddell, Washington, D.C. [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 2010, by bequest.
Title: Box with Miniature: Two Swans, Study
